intro: Gomphandra gracilis var. gracillima, commonly known as the slender gomphandra, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories where it thrives in cool, humid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists alike.
